title: Self-Directed Virtual Reality-Based Mathematics Pedagogy Design: Systems Thinking Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of secondary-level math fundamentals and digital device utilization skills
context.additional_context: Establishing VR-based mathematics education environments for adult learners and applying systems-thinking pedagogy.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and explain three-dimensional geometry concepts in VR environments.

Learners design solution strategies for three or more given math problems (e.g., optimization problems, algorithm design) using systems thinking approaches (system diagrams, causal loop diagrams, etc.) and achieve an average score of 4 or higher on a 5-point rubric through peer evaluation.
Learners develop and apply evaluation criteria for VR-based educational tools
Learners plan two math education scenarios for elementary students using digital tools (Google Docs, Canva, Kahoot!, etc.) and achieve a score of 4 or higher on a 5-point peer evaluation rubric.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
